title: Emotions and Personality 1
sentences: My brother is very happy with his birthday gift.
porque su perro se ha perdido.
She is sad because her dog is lost.
No me hables ahora, estoy un poco
Don't talk to me now; I'm a bit angry.
I am very tired after working ten hours.
I always get nervous before speaking in public.
My mother is worried because I am not arriving home.
We are very excited about our trip to Spain.
porque no tiene nada que hacer.
He is bored because he has nothing to do.
I was surprised by the news in the newspaper.
por el ruido de la tormenta.
The boy is scared by the noise of the storm.
Your best friend is very nice and kind.
That waiter is a bit unkind/unpleasant today.
Juan is very funny and always tells jokes.
Mi jefe es un hombre muy
My boss is a very serious and hard-working man.
I am a bit shy when I meet new people.
My sister is very talkative and doesn't stop talking.
You have to be patient with the new students.
y no me gusta esperar el bus.
I am very impatient and I don't like waiting for the bus.
Sometimes I am a bit lazy on Sunday afternoons.
She is very hard-working and always arrives early.
It is very important to be honest with your friends.
He is very generous and always shares his food.
y deja jugar a tu hermano.
Don't be selfish and let your brother play.
Mi padre es una persona muy
My father is a very calm/quiet person.
You have to be brave to tell the truth.
I am not a coward; I am just very careful.
I am very proud of your Spanish grades.
Don't be jealous of your little brother.
I think Juan is in love with his neighbor.
con las direcciones de este mapa.
I am confused with the directions on this map.
dictionary:
Contento/a - Happy
Triste - Sad
Enojado/a - Angry
Cansado/a - Tired
Nervioso/a - Nervous
Preocupado/a - Worried
Emocionado/a - Excited
Aburrido/a - Bored
Sorprendido/a - Surprised
Asustado/a - Scared
Simpático/a - Nice / Friendly
Antipático/a - Unkind / Mean
Divertido/a - Funny / Fun
Serio/a - Serious
Tímido/a - Shy
Hablador/a - Talkative
Paciente - Patient
Impaciente - Impatient
Vago/a - Lazy
Trabajador/a - Hard-working
Honesto/a - Honest
Generoso/a - Generous
Egoísta - Selfish
Tranquilo/a - Calm / Quiet
Valiente - Brave
Cobarde - Coward
Orgulloso/a - Proud
Celoso/a - Jealous
Enamorado/a - In love
Confundido/a - Confused
